mpl colormaps

This page gives an overview of the colormaps generated as potential replacements for matplotlib's default, jet.

Introduction

The viscm designer screen, used to define the 3-dimensionsional spline path taken by the colormap through the CAM02-UCS color space. This color space is transformed (warped) so that equal Euclidean distances represent approximately equal jumps in human perceptual difference.

Colormaps

Click on any of the figure below to expand.

Black Purple

Black Purple Yellow

Parula

Gray

Jet

How to generate

  1. Install the pycam02ucs package.
  2. Check out and run any of the colormap scripts.

To explore other colormaps:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from pycam02ucs.cm.viscm import viscm

viscm('jet')

plt.show()
